intro: Pacouria capensis, commonly known as the Cape spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has small, alternate leaves that are usually green and covered in fine hairs. Pacouria capensis is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
